extendedIngredients.name: arugula
extendedIngredients.original: 2 bunches arugula, thick stems removed (about 6 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: bocconcini
extendedIngredients.original: 12 ounces bocconcini (small balls of fresh mozzarella), cut in half, or fresh mozzarella, cut into bite-size pieces
extendedIngredients.originalName: bocconcini (small balls of fresh mozzarella), cut in half, or fresh mozzarella, cut into bite-size pieces

extendedIngredients.name: short pasta
extendedIngredients.original: 12 ounces short pasta (such as gemelli or penne; about 4 cups)

title: Pasta with Peppers and Mozzarella
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Pasta with Peppers and Mozzarellan a try. This recipe serves 4. One serving contains 676 calories, 28g of protein, and 33g of fat. For $2.44 per serving, this recipe covers 24% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 5 minutes. Head to the store and pick up short pasta, bocconcini, garlic, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 85%. This score is great. Try Marinated Peppers and Mozzarella, Bruschetta with Roasted Peppers & Mozzarella, and Pizza with Sweet Peppers and Mozzarella for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: No one wine will suit every pasta dish. Pasta in a tomato-based sauce will usually work well with a medium-bodied red, such as a montepulciano or chianti. Pasta with seafood or pesto will fare better with a light-bodied white, such as a pinot grigio. Cheese-heavy pasta can pair well with red or white - you might try a sangiovese wine for hard cheeses and a chardonnay for soft cheeses. We may be able to make a better recommendation if you ask again with a specific pasta dish.

instructions: Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water, drain the pasta, and set aside. Wipe out the pot. Heat the oil in the pasta pot over medium heat. Add the bell peppers and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until the peppers are tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the arugula, bocconcini, the cooked pasta, the reserved pasta water, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring, until the arugula is just wilted, about 1 minute.

steps.step: Cook the pasta according to the package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup of the cooking water, drain the pasta, and set aside. Wipe out the pot.
Heat the oil in the pasta pot over medium heat.
Add the bell peppers and garlic and cook, stirring occasionally, until the peppers are tender, 5 to 7 minutes.
Add the arugula, bocconcini, the cooked pasta, the reserved pasta water, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Cook, stirring, until the arugula is just wilted, about 1 minute.
